briefTitle: A Study to Compare Effectiveness and Safety of Darunavir/Ritonavir (DRV/Rtv) 800mg/100mg Once Daily Versus DRV/Rtv 600mg/100mg Twice Daily in Early Treatment-Experienced HIV-1 Infected Patients (ODIN)
officialTitle: A Randomized, Open-label Trial to Compare the Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of DRV/Rtv (800mg/100mg) q.d Versus DRV/Rtv (600mg/100mg) b.i.d in Early Treatment-experienced HIV-1 Infected Subjects
summary: The purpose of this study is to test if being treated with darunavir/ritonavir (DRV/rtv) 800/100 mg daily is as effective as being treated with DRV/rtv 600/100 mg twice daily, in early antiretroviral (ARV)-experienced patients when given along with selected optimized background regimen (OBR).

primaryOutcome.measure: Virological Response at Week 48 (Number of Participants With Plasma Viral Load Less Than 50 Copies/mL) - as Defined by the Time to Loss of Virologic Response (TLOVR) Algorithm
